meanings.definition: A broadcast made over the internet.
meanings.sent1: I watched a cybercast of the concert online.
meanings.sent2: The cybercast of the news was available on the website.
meanings.sent3: The cybercast of the weather report was so clear, it felt like the meteorologist was in my room!
meanings.sent4: Her voice cybercasted across the globe, reaching listeners in every corner.
meanings.sent5: The cybercast brought the event to life, as if I was there in person.

meanings.sent1: They decided to cybercast the event for those unable to attend.
meanings.sent2: We can cybercast the meeting to include remote participants.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally cybercasted my cat's meowing during the online class - it was quite a hit!
meanings.sent4: The message was cybercasted far and wide, spreading like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: She cybercasted her thoughts, sharing them with the world in an instant.
